summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). It is an agreement between the U.S. government and the defense to admit a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is the subject of this stipulation to be admitted as evidence.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense filed a joint stipulation to admit a 2009 deposition transcript as evidence in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a formal court stipulation agreeing that a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, is authentic and can be admitted as evidence at trial.
The stipulation is between the U.S. Attorney's Office (led by Damian Williams) and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team (four named attorneys).
The deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, in 2009.
The stipulation is dated November 2021, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's criminal case (S2 20 CR 330).
The document itself is marked as 'Government Exhibit 1007' for the trial.
